text:
1-Farming in Brooklyn: A truck farm in the Sheepshead Bay area. 2,3-Goats and sheep still roam Brooklyn's suburban streets. These views were taken at Pennsylvania and Stanley venues.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: February 24, 1931
View 2,3: August 4, 1934
title: Farming in Brooklyn.

Peddlers--Food: Itinerant food peddlers make their way through the streets of New York in all boroughs. Hot dogs and ice cream are their most common wares. View 1 is at Pennsylvania and Stanley Avenues, Brooklyn; view 2, on Thompson Street, near Washington Square, Manhattan; view 3, at 46th Avenue and 11th Street, Queens.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: August 4, 1934
View 2: May 27, 1935 - Neg # 2685
View 3: June 23, 1940
title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - [Brooklyn].

text:
Stanley Avenue, west from Pennsylvania Avenue, showing the thoroughfare before the W. P. A. started improvement operations. View 2 shows W. P. A. workmen at Snediker Avenue, eight blocks west of Pennsylvania Avenue.

October 21, 1935
Views 1,2

Works Progress Administration
Five Boroughs Project
